The Sādhu Jātaka
“Wonderful indeed in the world,
arose one who makes the hairs stand on end;
A divine chariot appeared,
for the famous one of Videha.”

“Having ascended this chariot,
best of kings, lord of the land,
the gods desire to see you,
the Tāvatiṁsa gods and the Sinda gods.
For the gods are longing,
in Sudhamma, they are waiting.”
Then the king, Sādhu,
Videha, the lord of Mithilā,

Sakka also rejoiced,🔽Videha, the lord of Mithilā;

“It is good that you have come,
to live in a dwelling of your own.
Live among the gods, O King,
who have all their desires fulfilled;
Among the Tāvatiṃsa gods,
enjoy divine sensual pleasures.”
